BooleanFeatureComputation
public class HasDigitFeature
extends java.lang.Object
implements BooleanFeatureComputation

A boolean feature computation to determine whether text has a digit.

Author:
Spence Koehler

computeFeature

public java.lang.Boolean computeFeature(java.lang.String text)
Compute whether the text contains at least one digit.

Specified by:
computeFeature in interface BooleanFeatureComputation
Returns:
true if a digit is found; otherwise, false.

split

public SegmentSequence split(java.lang.String text)
Splits the string to be alternating sequences of digits and letters.

The pivot index is the first index where the text has a digit.

If a word of text contains digits and letters, the full word delimited by spaces is kept together. Multiple words of digits and/or letters are also kept together along with their delimiting spaces.

Specified by:
split in interface BooleanFeatureComputation
Returns:
the split text sequence or null if there is no digit in the text.
